column4: what are the differences between gnome and kde? are they interchangable with ubuntu?
they are Desktop ENvironments they run on top of the 'core' of ubuntu, they are just graphical layers
is one faster than the other?
gnome is lighter is terms of software footprint, and some would say faster but its only cutting it by about 10-20 mb worth of ram
if you wanna go lighter don't use DEs use Window Managers standalone
ok I see. I just have whatever comes by default, I'm trying to figure out what sort of options there are
DEs include, GNome kde, lubuntu(though its just 'openbox' as the WM and lxpanel as the panel, xfce
and the desktop environments are not the same things as window managers
they are similar but include a set of applications when installed, many consider this to be 'heavy' as opposed to the lightweightness of WMs
ah I see. Would it be possible to try KDE or some other DE without installing all the apps that come with it? (I already have the ones that come with gnome)
not sure if kde has a 'core' version
maybe I could try a window manager or two then
ok, when they are installed you'll have to log out and change the session in gdm
ok, that is one thing I can definitely handle
still very new to how all of this works
